subject: Re: [junit] Displaying test case information during execution.
msgSnippet: ... The JUnit-addons test runner allows you to add arbitrary test listeners, one of which could print out that information. Try using it to run your tests.
messageBody:
gjanyavula wrote:

> I apologize if this is a repeat questions. I did some searching in
> the message archive but couldn't find the answer to my question.
>
> History: I'm running a test suite which has some test cases from with
> in a servlet.
>
> Question: I want to be able to display
>
> 1. TestCase name
> 2. TestCase method name
>
> during execution of each method of every test case. How do I
> accomplish this ?

The JUnit-addons test runner allows you to add arbitrary test listeners,
one of which could print out that information. Try using it to run your
tests. Google "JUnit-addons".
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
